Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 allegedly called Youth A names and attempted to provoke
him to fight.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was texted on 3/11/25 and a voicemail was left on
3/12/25. Complainant was noted as anonymous, but attempts
were made to contact but with no avail.
Administrator 1 reported via email on 3/17/25 the alleged
incident occurred on 2/8/25. Staff 1 was no longer working at the
facility.
Youth A is placed at Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center.
Consultant interviewed him on 3/13/25 face to face. Youth A
reported he got up when he heard cards shuffling and loud music. He
noticed Staff 1 playing with his cards. Youth A reported he asked Staff 1
why he was playing with his cards. Staff 1 said, “Shit gonna be taken”.
Youth A reported he challenged Staff 1 to take something else and Staff
1 took the remote. Staff 1 then approached Youth A, face to face, and
swung. Youth A stated Staff 2 stepped between them and Staff 1’s
swing did not connect. Youth A reported Staff 1 said, “I’ll swing on you
anytime” while Staff 2 guided Youth A away. Youth A reported
Supervisor came into the unit and removed Staff 1 from the room. Youth
A reported he was not hit nor injured in this incident. Youth A reported
Youth B and Youth C witnessed this incident.
The following interviews were conducted on 3/25/25 at the facility:
Youth B reported he was present in the unit when Staff 1 and Youth A
were arguing over playing cards. Youth B reported Staff 1 grabbed
Youth A’s playing cards and Youth A became upset. Youth B reported
he heard Staff 1 say, “I’ll take the remote.” After Staff 1 said this, he then
took the remote from Youth A. Youth A and Staff 1 then “got into each
other’s face.” Youth B reported when Staff 1 stood up to grab the
2

remote, he yanked up his pants as if taunting Youth A to fight him. When
they were face to face, they both pushed each other. Youth B reported
he did not see either hit or punch. Youth B reported Staff 2 took Youth A
to the other side of the unit and Supervisor came into the unit and Staff
1 left.
Youth C reported he was present in the unit when Staff 1 and Youth A
were arguing. Youth C could not remember what they were arguing over
or what they said. Youth C reported Staff 1 attempted to “swing” on
Youth A but missed. Youth C reported both Staff 1 and Youth A were
swearing and getting loud. Youth C reported Staff 2 took Youth A into
another area of the unit and then Staff 1 left the unit.
Staff 2 reported she was playing cards in the unit with Youth B.
Youth A and Youth C were in the unit as well. Youth A was at a
“high speed” so he was sitting on the couch attempting to
deescalate. Staff 1 came into the unit to provide a break to the
other staff (unknown) in the unit. Staff 2 grabbed a separate set of
cards and Youth A said, “those are mine.” Staff 1 responded by
saying, “quit acting like a bitch.” Youth A then came over to the
table and grabbed his cards from the table and sat back down.
Both Staff 1 and Youth A began arguing and Staff 2 heard Staff 1
say, “say that to my face.” Staff 2 reported the statements from
Staff 1 were aggressive. Staff 2 could not remember all the words
used. Both Youth A and Staff 1 then walked towards each other
and Staff 2 reported she went between them. Staff 2 reported she
took Youth A to another part of the unit and called on the radio for
Supervisor to help. Staff 1 continued to say words to Youth A as
she moved him. Supervisor came into the unit and Staff 1 left with
her. Staff 2 reported she never saw anyone pushing or hitting.
Staff 2 reported she was able to get between them.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on 3/31/25. Supervisor
reported she did not see the incident but was told my Staff 2 that
Staff 1 and Youth A were arguing and that she was able to
separate them. Staff 2 had told her Staff 1 was “stepping up” to
Youth A as if to physically fight him. Supervisor reported Staff 1
was sent home.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 3/28/25. Staff 1 reported
he came into the unit and grabbed the playing cards. Youth A got
upset and started arguing with him. Staff 1 reported he told Youth
A he “would take the remote too.” Staff 1 reported he had just
went to a training at the facility where the trainer told them that if a
youth has something they are not supposed to, staff can take it.
Staff 1 reported he walked up to Youth A and grabbed the remote
from his hands. Youth A began cussing at him and then Staff 2
3

came over and grabbed Youth A and took him to the back of the
unit. Staff 1 reported he did not call Youth A any names, did not
swear at him, or attempt to hit him or push him. Staff 1 reported he
felt Staff 2 overreacted to the situation. Staff 2 reported he left the
unit because he was done covering a break for a staff in the unit.
Video Reviewed
The agency does have cameras, but video footage was
unavailable as the incident took place outside of the agency’s
video footage retention.
Documents Reviewed:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file
o Staff 1 was hired on 10/7/24
o Central registry was completed on 9/25/24
o Staff 1 received training on “Punitive measures”,
“Behavior Management” on 9/12/24.
o Staff 1 was terminated due to this incident.
Employee Counseling Form dated 2/8/25, reported
Staff 1 had “unsatisfactory work performance. It was
noted as “erratic work behavior.”
• I reviewed the Behavior Notification Form. The form was
dated 2/8/25 and reported by Staff 2 to Supervisor.
Staff began to make unnecessary comments such
as “Fuck them cards” and “bitch ass nigga.” Staff
begin to walk to Youth A getting into Youth A’s face
threatening to “whoop his ass.”
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Based on interviews with
youth and staff, Staff 1 was verbally aggressive with Youth A. He
swore at Youth A and threatened Youth A. The incident report
written on 2/8/25, confirmed he threatened Youth A by threatening
to “whoop his ass.” Staff 1 also called Youth A derogatory names.
Technial Assistance:
Staff 1 was hired by the agency through a “temp agency.” It was
noted on the personnel file that he was hired on 10/7/24, yet he
received the agency’s orientation on 9/12/24. Staff 1 was
employed and received financial compensation from the agency
for this orientation. R. 400.4128 (1) states, “the licensee shall
provide an orientation program for new employees…” Staff 1 was
considered an employee when he received orientation; therefore,
all other rules outlined in the Licensing Rules for Child Caring
Institutions, must be followed. Administrator 2 reported the agency
4

no longer uses the “temp agency” and that they were only used for
a critical time for the agency. If the agency decided to use a “temp
agency” in the future, policies and procedures will need to be
completed to ensure this method of hiring is in accordance with
rules.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
